detail_description: Maratha Palace, also known as Aranmanai, is a magnificent palace in Thanjavur that was once occupied by the Bhonsle family from 1674 to 1855. The construction of this impressive structure began in 1534 under the Nayak rulers and was completed in 1535. A blend of Nayak and Maratha architectural styles, it stands as one of the top tourist attractions in Thanjavur.
name: Maratha Palace

excerpt: Educational showcase of ornate sculptures, paintings & other ancient artworks & artifacts.
detail_description: The Royal Palace Museum, also known as Thanjavur Palace or Aranmanai, is a historical treasure trove showcasing ornate sculptures, paintings, and ancient artifacts. Originally built by the rulers of Thanjavur Nayak Dynasty and later used as the official residence of Thanjavur Maratha, this museum offers a glimpse into the region's rich history. Visitors can immerse themselves in the opulent halls and discover the cultural heritage through its educational displays.
name: Royal Palace Museum
address: Q4VQ+53C, Rajakrisnapuram, Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu 613001, India

excerpt: One of the oldest libraries in Asia housing a collection of Palm leaf manuscripts & medieval texts.
detail_description: Saraswathi Mahal Library, located in Thanjavur, is one of the oldest libraries in Asia and a must-visit for anyone exploring the area. It houses a remarkable collection of ancient palm-leaf manuscripts and medieval texts in various languages such as Tamil, Hindi, Telugu, Marathi, and English. The library also boasts over 60,000 preserved volumes with only a small fraction on display for visitors to see.
name: Saraswathi Mahal Library
address: Q4RP+MJX, E Main St, Rajakrisnapuram, Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu 613001, India

detail_description: Sangeetha Mahal, also known as the Hall of Music, is a fascinating attraction within the Thanjavur Royal Palace complex. Constructed in the 17th century under Maratha rule, this hall was originally designed for musical concerts and performances. It boasts exceptional acoustics and architectural features that were specifically crafted to enhance sound quality. Visitors can appreciate its historical significance and enjoy dance and music concerts held throughout the year in this medium-sized venue with good lighting and sound systems.
name: Sangeetha Mahal

detail_description: The Art Gallery Thanjavur is a must-visit attraction located within the Nayak Durbar Hall of the Thanjavur Royal Palace. It houses an impressive collection of ancient sculptures, paintings, and artifacts that showcase the grandeur of Thanjavur's cultural heritage. Visitors can marvel at well-preserved bronze statues, original Thanjavur paintings, and unique items like books on animal anatomy and palm leaf inscriptions.
name: The Art Gallery Thanjavur
address: Maratha Palace, Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu 613001, India

excerpt: Vast Chola-dynasty temple complex dedicated to Shiva, with 64-metre tower and fresco-lined interior.
detail_description: The Brihadeeswara Temple is a grand temple complex devoted to Lord Shiva, constructed during the Chola dynasty. The complex comprises a 64-meter tower and an interior adorned with frescoes. The temple's honey-hued granite dominates the morning sunlight while capturing a vivid palette of reds, oranges, yellows, and pinks in the evening.
name: Brihadeeswara Temple
address: Balaganapathy Nagar, Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu 613007, India

detail_description: Murugan Art Gallery in Thanjavur is a must-visit for art enthusiasts. The gallery showcases the traditional Thanjavur paintings, a classical South Indian art form. Visitors can witness the creation of these exquisite artworks and even purchase them. Mr. Marimuthu, an expert in this field, runs the gallery and is dedicated to preserving this ancient art form. The gallery offers a range of hand-painted Thanjavur art pieces in various sizes, all reasonably priced.
name: Murugan Art gallery - Tanjore Art Works | Thanjavur Paintings
address: No, 39B, 2nd Street , Kannan Nagar Govt arts college (women)- opposite, Tamil Nadu 613007, India

detail_description: Siva Ganga Tank is a must-see attraction in Thanjavur, situated at the heart of the city. This historic 16th-century square tank was originally constructed to supply water to the palace and is now surrounded by lush gardens, making it a popular park and picnic spot. Visitors can also enjoy boating on the tranquil waters of this ancient reservoir.
name: Siva Ganga Tank

detail_description: Arulmigu Manikundra Perumal Temple, also known as Thanjai Mamani Koil or Thanjai Periya Kovil, is a significant pilgrimage site in Thanjavur. This divyadesham comprises three Vishnu temples housed under one roof. The spiritual ambiance of the area attracts visitors from around the globe who seek blessings from the deity appearing as Lord Varaha (The Boar-faced God).
name: 108 Divya Desam - 20 A | Arulmigu Manikundra Perumal Temple, Thanjai Mamani Koil
address: R48P+PWX, Sathya Krishna Nagar, Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu 613002, India

name: VINAYAGA ARTS AND CRAFT- TANJORE PAINTINGS
address: 618, E Main St, opposite to Thanjavur Palace, MAIN GATE, Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu 613001, India

detail_description: Sathars Restaurant is a popular dining spot in Thanjavur, offering a variety of non-vegetarian dishes and biryani. The restaurant is known for its authentic Thanjavur style chicken biryani, which is praised for its delicious taste and settled flavors. However, some customers find the portion size to be insufficient for the price. The restaurant's ambience is pleasant, and it offers paid parking nearby.
name: Sathars Restaurant
address: 167, Gandhiji Rd, near valanadu silk house, Attar Mohalla, Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu 613001, India

detail_description: Arulmigu Aiyarappar Temple, also known as Shri Panchanatheeswarar Shiva temple, is a Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva located in Tiruvaiyaru, Tamil Nadu. The temple is famous for its association with the Five Rivers and is revered in ancient Tamil texts. It features beautiful shrines of various deities and is managed by the Thiruvaduthurai Adheenam.
name: Arulmigu Aiyarappar Temple
address: State Highway 22, SH 22, Thiruvaiyaru, Tamil Nadu 613204, India

excerpt: Shaded paths around a gilt memorial to an ancient king & a museum with a brightly decorated tower.
detail_description: Rajarajan Manimandapam is a must-see attraction in the area, offering a glimpse into the Rajaraja era with interesting artifacts and information. Visitors can explore the underground museum for insights into the Chola empire and its art and lifestyle. The site also features a children's park for little ones to enjoy, while adults can appreciate the serene atmosphere. However, some visitors suggest that maintenance work is needed, including improvements to lawns and lighting.
name: Manimandapam
address: Q4CJ+3CF, New Bus Stand Rd, Nirmala nagar RESIDENTIAL AREA, Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu 613007, India

excerpt: Shaded paths around a gilt memorial to an ancient king & a museum with a brightly decorated tower.
detail_description: Manimandapam in Thanjavur is a remarkable site dedicated to the legacy of Raja Raja Chola, the king responsible for the iconic Brihadeeswarar Temple. The monument features intricate sculptures depicting his achievements and the grandeur of the Chola dynasty. Visitors can stroll along shaded paths and admire a gilt memorial while enjoying a peaceful atmosphere with stunning views of the temple and its surroundings.
name: Manimandapam
address: Q4CJ+3CF, New Bus Stand Rd, Nirmala nagar RESIDENTIAL AREA, Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu 613007, India

detail_description: In the city of Thanjavur, one of the notable attractions is the Subramanian Murugan temple. Although smaller in size compared to other temples in the area, it holds a special charm for visitors. The temple is known for its unique decorations of Lord Murugan, reminiscent of those found in Pazhani. It's a place that holds personal significance for many and is worth a visit when exploring the cultural and historical sites around Thanjavur.
name: Subramanian Murugan temple, முருகன் கோவில்
address: 782, S.N.M Rahman Nagar, Sirajudeen Nagar, Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu 613001, India

detail_description: Thanjavur is home to some stunning waterfalls, including Agaya Gangai, Kutladampatti Waterfalls, and Kiliyur Falls. Agaya Gangai stands out at a towering 300 feet and is located about 141 km from Thanjavur. It's formed on the river Aiyaru, offering a breathtaking sight for visitors.
name: Water
address: South Rampart, Palliyeri, Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu 613008

excerpt: 16th-century fortress & royal residence with towers, tunnels, an art collection & a whale skeleton.
detail_description: The Thanjavur Maratha Palace, a 16th-century fortress and royal residence, boasts towers, tunnels, an art collection, and even a whale skeleton. The palace houses a remarkable array of legacy statues from the Chola Kingdom as well as rare statues dating back to the 16th century. However, there are concerns about maintenance and preservation due to neglect and vandalism.
name: Thanjavur Maratha Palace
address: Q4RP+HC5, Rajakrisnapuram, Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu 613001, India

detail_description: Thanjavur Sri Bangaru Kamakshi Amman Temple is a revered spiritual destination dedicated to the goddess Kamakshi, an incarnation of Parvati. The temple is renowned for its rare and highly venerated golden idol of the goddess. It holds historical significance as it houses the idol that was shifted from Kanchipuram due to invasions. The temple's location in a crowded street adds to its charm, and visitors can also explore nearby temples like Sri Rama and Sri Krishna temples.
name: Thanjavur Sri Bangaru Kamakshi Amman Temple
address: Q4VH+5P4, W Main St, Mettu Theru, Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu 613008, India

detail_description: CSI Christ Church Fort, also known as Schwartz Church or the New Jerusalem Church, is a remarkable historical site located near the Thanjavur Palace in Tamil Nadu. Constructed in 1779 by Raja Serfoji to honor his mentor, Reverend Christian Friedrich Schwartz—a Danish missionary—the church showcases a beautiful blend of European and Indian architectural styles. Its pristine white façade and tranquil ambiance make it an inviting place for visitors seeking both spiritual solace and a glimpse into colonial history.
name: CSI Christ Church Fort
address: Fort, Sivaganga Garden, Balaganapathy Nagar, Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu 613007, India
